definition[0]: to persuade someone not to do something, especially by making it seem difficult or bad
example[1]: My father is a lawyer, and he discouraged me from entering the field.
definition[1]: to make someone less confident or less willing to do something
example[3]: You should not let one failure discourage you.
definition[2]: to make something less likely to happen
example[4]: Aspirin may discourage tumour growth in some types of cancer.
